div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.strong: Humble ISD Plans July Graduation Ceremonies

p.br: Wearing a cap and gown, graduating in front of family, is a treasured memory throughout life! Humble ISD is committed to providing a graduation ceremony for the Class of 2020. While graduation cannot be held on Saturday, May 23, at NRG Stadium, we are planning to hold graduation in July if permitted. Read about the plans.

a.title: Go to comments for Humble ISD Plans July Graduation Ceremonies

span.strong: Retired Humble ISD Superintendent Dr. Guy M. Sconzo remembered as inspiring leader
span.span: We are deeply saddened to share that retired Humble ISD Superintendent Dr. Guy Sconzo passed away on Tuesday, April 21, 2020, after a battle with cancer. Photographs and memories may be viewed here.

a.title: Go to comments for Retired Humble ISD Superintendent Dr. Guy M. Sconzo remembered as inspiring leader

span.p:
Online Learning Continues for 2019-2020
Governor Greg Abbott’s executive order issued on April 17, 2020, will keep classrooms closed to students throughout Texas for the remainder of the school year as part of a larger plan to protect public health. Humble ISD schools will continue to provide online learning for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. In addition, the district will continue to offer carry-out meals for children. More Information

a.title: Go to comments for Online Learning Continues for 2019-2020

p.br:
The 4th nine-week grading period begins on Monday, March 30.
Update on grading policy
Actualización sobre la política de calificaciones

a.title: Go to comments for Grading March 30 - May 29, 2020

span.p:
COVID-19 Self-Reporting to Humble ISD Health Services
Humble ISD is committed to public health. If a student or staff member tests positive for COVID-19, or is exposed to someone who tests positive, please share that information with Humble ISD Health Services by completing this online form. School nurses will monitor cases and ensure communicable disease protocols are adhered to when buildings reopen.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Self-Reporting to Humble ISD Health Services

p.br: Parents of incoming kindergarten students in Humble ISD are asked to pre-register online now for the 2020-2021 school year by Friday, May 15. Pre-registering helps schools best plan for next year's classes. Parents of current Humble ISD PreK students do not need to complete pre-registration. All required documentation must be uploaded into the enrollment form or emailed to the campus Registrar before the enrollment process is complete. More Information

a.title: Go to comments for Kindergarten Pre-Registration for the 2020-2021 School Year

span.p:
Attention Seniors: Lone Star College Funding Opportunities
Figuring out how to pay for college should not be an additional source of stress for graduating seniors. See how Lone Star College can help!

a.title: Go to comments for Lone Star College Funding Opportunities

img.alt: Retention Stipend Approved for 2,900 More Humble ISD Employees

a.span: Retention Stipend Approved for 2,900 More Humble ISD Employees

div.p: The Humble ISD School Board approves $1,000 retention stipend for app. 2,900 more Humble ISD employees.

a.title: Go to comments for Retention Stipend Approved for 2,900 More Humble ISD Employees

div.p: More than 100 years of excellence and innovation
Humble ISD covers 93.7 square miles in the Lake Houston Area
Education Foundation has awarded $13 million to projects since 2000
